messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php`, I found that `CommentController` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full request paths and allowed methods (for the routes that point to app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php):

1) Path: /comments
   - Methods allowed: POST = true
   - All methods allowed: false
   - HEAD: false
   - OPTIONS: false
   - TRACE: false
   - GET: false
   - PUT: false
   - DELETE: false
   - PATCH: false

2) Path: /comments/{comment}
   - Methods allowed: DELETE = true
   - All methods allowed: false
   - HEAD: false
   - OPTIONS: false
   - TRACE: false
   - GET: false
   - POST: false
   - PUT: false
   - PATCH: false

Explanation

- routes/auth.php contains the line Route::resource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['store', 'destroy']); inside a middleware group. The resource(...) mapping in Laravel yields:
  - store => POST /comments
  - destroy => DELETE /comments/{comment}
  Those two are the only routes generated here for App\Http\Controllers\CommentController.

- The store(...) method in app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php implements creating a comment and therefore corresponds to POST /comments.

- The destroy(Comment $comment) method implements deletion and therefore corresponds to DELETE /comments/{comment}. The {comment} path parameter is the route-model-bound parameter name used by resource routes.

- "All methods acceptable" is false â€” only the explicitly registered methods (POST for store and DELETE for destroy) are created by the resource() call shown.

- HEAD is false because no GET route is defined for these endpoints; Laravel automatically provides HEAD only for routes defined with GET. The code does not define any GET routes for these paths, so HEAD is not present based on the shown route definitions.

- OPTIONS and TRACE are not explicitly defined in the provided route definitions, so they are reported false (the determination is made from the code/routes shown, per your instruction).

- There is an Admin::CommentController defined in routes/admin.php that also declares resource('comments', ...) (with different allowed actions), but that is a different controller (App\Http\Controllers\Admin\CommentController). The answers above pertain only to the CommentController at app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php as requested.
